Question: Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
Which person can legally stop and do a roadside check of your vehicle?
What is the maximum legal speed limit for a car towing a trailer on the open road?
What must you do if glass falls on to the road from your vehicle?

Answers.Answer: Sweep it up straight away if you can do so safely

Question: Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
How can small amounts of alcohol affect your driving?

Answers.Answer: You can judge your speed more easily
Your driving reactions will be quicker

Question: Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
What does this sign mean?
What should you do if an ambulance comes up behind you, flashing red lights or sounding its siren?

Answers.Answer: Put your vehicle hazard lights on and drive on at the same speed
Slow down, pull over and allow the ambulance to pass
Flash your vehicle headlights to warn oncoming traffic

Question: What is the maximum speed you may drive if you have a ‘space saver wheel’ fitted?
Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
A warrant of fitness is to show:

Answers.Answer: the year the vehicle was made
if the driver has had any crashes
how many times the vehicle has crashed
that the vehicle was roadworthy at the time of checking

Question: What does this road marking mean?

Answers.Answer: Vehicles displaying a mobility card may park here
You can park your wheelchair here
Wheelchair parking space for the next 30 metres

Question: What is the closest distance your vehicle may be parked to a vehicle entrance?
When following a vehicle on a dusty metal (gravel) road, you should:

Answers.Answer: keep close to the other vehicles
drive down the centre of the road
adjust your speed to suit the conditions
pass the vehicle in front of you

Question: You should check that there is space for your vehicle on the other side of the crossing before going over a railway level crossing.
If you have had a flat tyre and have fitted a ‘space saver wheel’ what must you do?

Answers.Answer: Drive directly to a place where the flat tyre can be repaired and replaced
Drive at 40km/h until the flat tyre has been repaired
Lower the pressure in the other tyres

Question: You must NOT park on the right-hand side of the road, except when:
What do these road markings mean?

Answers.Answer: Turning vehicles should enter turning lane at arrows and avoid striped area
Turning vehicles should avoid all road markings and use the left-hand lane
All vehicles can make a U-turn at these road markings
Turning vehicles drive straight over all road markings and wait to turn right

Question: When turning right from a two-laned road into a one-way street that has two lanes, which lane must you turn into?

Answers.Answer: The lane that has the least vehicles
The lane that gives you the most direct route

Question: Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
What colour is the line painted on a sealed road at a Give Way sign?
Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
What does this traffic signal mean?

Answers.Answer: Drive on before the signal changes to red
Drive on because the signal will turn green
Stop if you can do so safely
Stop only if traffic is in the way

Question: A broken yellow line painted close to the edge of the road means you may stop or park your vehicle there at any time.
What is the speed limit for vehicles passing a school bus that has stopped to let children on or off?
What must you do when you hear a siren or see red flashing lights from an ambulance or fire engine?

Answers.Answer: Speed up to get out of the way
Pull over and allow it to pass

Question: You are driving in a 100km/h speed area and you see an Accident sign. What speed must you slow down to?
Who may legally require you to give a blood sample?

Answers.Answer: A police officer, an ambulance officer, other crash party
A medical doctor, other crash party, a police officer
A police officer, a medical doctor or an approved person
An ambulance driver, an approved person or a medical doctor

Question: Your vehicle has a current warrant of fitness but a rear red brake light (stop light) is not working. What should you do?

Answers.Answer: Only use the vehicle during daylight hours
Only use the vehicle in a 50km/h speed zone

Question: On a Transit Lane sign, what does T2 mean?

Answers.Answer: Vehicles that use the lane must have at least two people.
Vehicles that use the lane must have two passengers
Only two vehicles are permitted on the transit lane at any time
There are two transit lanes ahead

Question: If you have a restricted licence you can carry a passenger if they are your spouse.
What must you do if you want to turn right at traffic signals where a green light is showing?

Answers.Answer: Push your way through the vehicles coming towards you
Give way to vehicles coming towards you
Wait until the lights change to red and then turn quickly
Turn at once as the vehicles coming towards you will be stopped

Question: What should you do if the vehicle behind you wishes to pass?

Answers.Answer: Move to the centre so that they cannot pass
Speed up so that they will not need to pass
Move as far to the left side of the road as is safe
